album.title: The Heavyweight Champion: The Complete Atlantic Recordings (disc 2)

wiki.content:
John Coltrane - tenor sax
 Tommy Flanagan - piano
 Paul Chambers - bass
 Art Taylor - drums
 
 Written by John Coltrane
 Recorded May 4, 1959 at Atlantic Studios, New York
 Originally released on the album Giant Steps, Atlantic SD-1311, January 1960
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary:
John Coltrane - tenor sax
 Tommy Flanagan - piano
 Paul Chambers - bass
 Art Taylor - drums  Written by John Coltrane
 Recorded May 4, 1959 at Atlantic Studios, New York
 Originally released on the album Giant Steps, Atlantic SD-1311, January 1960

name: Spiral
comments: indeed each of the recordings made by him is worth it to get it.
love it who's playing piano?
Giant Steps is so strong beginning to end. Tight. Swinging. Beautiful.
Yeah that's Paul Chambers... he is on nearly every Coltrane recording.  Elvin Jones playin drums on most too.  :)
heavyweight!!!!!!!!!!!!!
coltrane rules!
This solo is blowing my mind.
Coltrane is an inspiration
spiritual intuition and harmonious dedication to the highest philosophical treatise of music
That main motive is killer
Yes this tune demands your total attention
Or being happily engaged in a pleasing task....
Not for analyzing, for floating away into fantasies....
A celebration of harmony, tones, and  inspiration........
paul chambers on double bass I believe
who's that on bass?
Sick
Very smooth.

Very nice head. I love how the progression descends chromatically. Coltrane accentuates every change perfectly.
Very nice indeed.
genius
